title: Simple circuits - which bulb has net charge motion

content.question: In which of the following circuits will there be a net motion of charge carriers through the lightbulb?

choices.label: The figure shows a rectangular circuit diagram with a battery, an open switch, a resistor, and a lightbulb. The circuit has three vertical branches and two horizontal branches. The left vertical branch has the battery. The middle vertical branch has the lightbulb. From left to right, the top horizontal branch has the open switch between the left and middle vertical branches, and has the resistor between the middle and right vertical branches.

The figure shows a rectangular circuit diagram with a battery, a closed switch, a resistor, and a lightbulb. The circuit has three vertical branches and two horizontal branches. The left vertical branch has the battery. The middle vertical branch has the lightbulb. The right vertical branch has the closed switch. The top horizontal branch has the resistor between the left and middle vertical branches.

The bottom horizontal branch has the closed switch.

content.answer: The figure shows a rectangular circuit diagram with a battery, an open switch, a resistor, and a lightbulb. The circuit has three vertical branches and two horizontal branches.
